title: New $150m fund targets net zero “disruption” start-ups across energy, transport, recycling
summary: Pollination, a specialist investment firm, has launched a $150 million venture capital fund to support climate and nature start-ups. The fund will target companies in five sectors: energy, transport, food and agriculture, carbon and nature management, and the circular economy. Pollination will invest up to $12 million in each company to develop prototypes or scale up their operations.
greenwashing: The article does not provide evidence of greenwashing.

title: Global Solar Panel Recycling Market Analysis 2024-2034, Featuring First Solar, Sharp, Trina Solar, We Recycle Solar, Reiling and Yingli Energy Co.
summary: The global solar panel recycling market is experiencing significant growth due to the rising adoption of solar energy and the increasing need for sustainable waste management. The market is expected to reach $1.86 billion by 2034, driven by government regulations and the emergence of innovative recycling technologies. Key players in the market include First Solar, Inc., Sharp Corporation, Trina Solar, and We Recycle Solar, among others.

title: Information knowledge and innovation management
summary: This research project explored how organizational and network capital contribute to the renewal and creation of paths within industries. The study focused on two old industrial regions, South Yorkshire and the North Region of Portugal, observing firms that successfully adapted through innovative restructuring. The findings highlighted the importance of regional embedded competences, access to knowledge transfer centers, and collaborative learning in driving the rejuvenation of these industries.

title: Global Soy-Based Chemicals Market to Reach USD 61591.8 million by 2034, Driven by Eco-Friendly Trends
summary: The global soy-based chemicals market is projected to grow significantly, reaching USD 61,591.8 million by 2034. This growth is driven by the increasing demand for sustainable and eco-friendly alternatives to traditional petrochemicals. Soy-based chemicals are used in various industries, including cosmetics, food, agriculture, and textiles, due to their biodegradability and reduced environmental impact.
greenwashing: The article does not provide any information to suggest that soy-based chemicals are being marketed using deceptive or misleading claims about their environmental benefits, so greenwashing is not evident.

title: A sewage treatment plant as a source of raw materials
summary: Researchers at the University of Stuttgart and Karlsruhe Institute of Technology (KIT) are developing a new wastewater treatment process that recovers valuable raw materials from sewage. This process, which involves a pilot biorefinery, aims to reduce climate-damaging emissions and produce valuable products like fertilizer, hydrogen, and bioplastics.
official_company_name: KoalAplan is not a company, but a research project. The company most closely associated is likely the University of Stuttgart.

title: Aspen Aerogels Announces Thermal Barrier Award from Valmet Automotive for Electric Porsche 718 Series and Reiterates 2024 Financial Outlook
summary: Aspen Aerogels, a sustainability and electrification solutions company, has been awarded a contract by Valmet Automotive to supply PyroThin® thermal barrier technology for the upcoming electric Porsche 718 series. This contract is significant for Aspen as it strengthens their position in the EV market and contributes to their overall financial outlook, which remains unchanged for 2024.
